Assuming that `i` was meant to be `o` (since it's used in the same way as the loop control variable in the first part of the loop), and correcting the loop to reflect a standard selection sort algorithm, the loop invariant for the i-th iteration would be:

"min_value = min(arr[o+1]->arr[len(arr)-1])"

This invariant holds after the i-th iteration of the outer loop, indicating that the smallest value from `arr[o+1]` to `arr[len(arr)-1]` has been moved to the `arr[o]` position. Note that I've adjusted the loop invariant to reflect the corrected variable `o` and the typical behavior of the selection sort algorithm."
